> Ok, here's the reminder:
> 
> No debate in this forum about the rules.  Votes only.  Votes will be 
> taken by emailing this group with either a yes or no vote for each 
> section of rules or a yes or no vote for the entire set of rules.  
> Anybody may vote (including those who worked on the rules).  
Violation 
> of these conditions will result in a mild form of punishment.  
> Questions about clarification of each proposed rule are allowed as 
> long as no comment about the proposed rule is made.  
> 
> example of something not allowed:  "I'd vote for this rule if it 
means 
> . . .".
> 
> example of something allowed: "How does this specific rules apply in 
> this condition?"

Why do the proposed rules have to be adopted?  It is a way of keeping 
the people working on the proposed tournament rules from going 
overboard by being too strict.

Here's my vote: I am for all the proposed rules.
